abstract: Neel Kashkari, the former Bush administration official who oversaw the Treasury Department’s sweeping bank rescue plan during the financial crisis, is leaving Pimco to consider running for office in his adopted home state of California.
snippet: Neel Kashkari, the former Bush administration official who oversaw the Treasury Department’s sweeping bank rescue plan during the financial crisis, is leaving Pimco to consider running for office in his adopted home state of California.
lead_paragraph: More than four years after the financial crisis, one of the top figures behind the Bush administration’s sweeping rescue plan is considering a return to government service.

headline.main: Kashkari, Onetime $700 Billion Man at Treasury, Weighs Political Bid

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
